data.question: Which of the following statements concerning Six Sigma is NOT true?
items: Six Sigma is a measure of deviation or variability
Six Sigma is a process, quality, goal or objective
Six Sigma is a statistical measure of performance
Six Sigma has a non-conformance level of 4.3 DPM opportunities
data.explanation: Six Sigma has a non-conformance level of 3.4 defects per million.

data.question: How many defects per million opportunities does a process have when Six Sigma is reached?
data.explanation: Six Sigma has a non-conformance level of 3.4 defects per million.

data.question: Which of the following is NOT an advantage of using Six Sigma?
data.explanation: Six Sigma is data driven, not driven by customer satisfaction.

data.question: Which of the following is NOT a required condition to make Six Sigma work?
items: The customer's needs are truly your first priority
People are the focus; you train, empower, and involve them
You establish performance standards and use exception reporting
All of the above are required conditions
data.explanation: Six Sigma requires having the customer needs be the first priority. This is, however, different from being customer driven. The focus will be on people and on establishing performance standards that use exception reporting.

data.question: Which of the following is NOT a step in the Six Sigma process?
data.explanation: The steps in a Six Sigma process include determining what your product or service is, determining who your customer is, determining what your customer's requirements and expectations are, determining the requirements to meet the customer's expectations, conducting a gap analysis, determining what training is needed, forming project teams, mapping the processes, implementing the methodology, mistake-proofing the process, establishing measurements, and continuing the gains.

data.question: Which of the following is NOT part of the DMAIC Process?
data.explanation: The steps of the DMAIC process include Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve, and Control.
